1/*\ 2 * scale 3 [ control ] 4 ** 5 * The scale control is used to display the map scale with relation to a screen pixels to 6 * real world distance mapping. 7 ** 8 > Options 9 ** 10 - className (string) the classname of the element that will be created (default: `mc-scale`) 11 - alignment (string) the alignment for the scale control (default: `bottom-10 left+10`) 12 - scales (array) the scales that will be displayed in the scalebar (default: ['metric', 'imperial']) 13 ** 14 = (DOMElement) the dom element that contains the scale 15\*/ 16MapControls.register('scale', function(opts) { 17 // initialise option defaults 18 opts.className = opts.className || 'mc-scale'; 19 opts.scales = opts.scales || ['metric', 'imperial']; 20 21 // initialise the default alignment 22 opts.alignment = opts.alignment || 'bottom-10 left+10'; 23 24 // initialise the zoombar element 25 var scaleContainer = MapControls._createEl('div', { className: opts.className }), 26 scales = {}, 27 labels = {}; 28 29 // create the scales 30 for (var ii = 0; ii < opts.scales.length; ii++) { 31 var scaleName = opts.scales[ii]; 32 33 scales[scaleName] = MapControls._createEl('div', { 34 className: opts.className + '-' + scaleName + ' ' + opts.className + '-' + ii 35 }); 36 37 labels[scaleName] = MapControls._createEl('span', { 38 className: opts.className + '-label' + ' ' + opts.className + '-label-' + ii, 39 textContent: scaleName 40 }); 41 42 scales[scaleName].appendChild(labels[scaleName]); 43 scaleContainer.appendChild(scales[scaleName]); 44 } 45 46 return { 47 element: scaleContainer 48 }; 49});
